channel.title: Hierarchical Rl on Sukai Huang
channel.description: Recent content in Hierarchical Rl on Sukai Huang

item.title: Discover Hierarchical Achieve in Rl via Cl 2023
item.description:
[TOC]

  1. Title: Discovering Hierarchical Achievements in Reinforcement Learning via Contrastive Learning
  2. Author: Seungyong Moon et. al.
  3. Publish Year: 2 Nov 2023
  4. Review Date: Tue, Apr 2, 2024
  5. url: https://arxiv.org/abs/2307.03486

Summary of paper

Contribution

  • PPO agents demonstrate some ability to predict future achievements. Leveraging this observation, a novel contrastive learning method called achievement distillation is introduced, enhancing the agent’s predictive abilities. This approach excels at discovering hierarchical achievements,

Some key terms

Model based and explicit module in previous studies are not that good

item.title: Hengyuan_hu Hierarchical Decision Making by Generating and Following Natural Language Instructions 2019
item.description:
[TOC]

  1. Title: Hierarchical Decision Making by Generating and Following Natural Language Instructions
  2. Author: Hengyuan Hu et. al. FAIR
  3. Publish Year: 2019
  4. Review Date: Dec 2021

Summary of paper

One line summary: they build a Architect Builder model to clone human behaviour for playing RTS game

Their task environment is very similar to IGLU competition setting, but their model is too task-specific

The author mentioned some properties about natural language instructions

item.title: Jacob_andreas Modular Multitask Reinforcement Learning With Policy Sketches 2017
item.description:
1. Title: Modular Multitask Reinforcement Learning with Policy Sketches
  2. Author: Jacob Andreas et. al.
  3. Publish Year: 2017
  4. Review Date: Dec 2021

Background info for this paper:

Their paper describe a framework that is inspired by on options MDP, for which a reinforcement learning task is handled by several sub-MDP modules. (that is why they call it Modular RL)

They consider a multitask RL problem in a shared environment. (See the figure below). The IGLU Minecraft challenge as well as Angry Birds also belongs to this category.
